review_text: As a health care professional, I have a lot of mixed feelings about supplements. This industry is very poorly regulated, and many times we take supplements that we don’t even need and waste a lot of money doing so. This supplement definitely feels unnecessary to me, and it is overpriced for what it is. While Hum beauty drink supplements have fun flavors, this product reminded me too much of Emergen-c. Even if price is not a determining factor for you, there are other drink mixes out there that deliver  more. I would not recommend this unless you truly enjoy it for the taste.

review_text: I tried this night cream because I’ve recently noticed more sun/age spots on my skin. I really like the way this smells (a bit floral) and it tingles a bit as soon as you apply it, which I often associate with ’working’. The reason for the one star is that it made me break out like crazy, I’ve never had acne, and I couldn’t figure out where the breakouts were originating. After some research I learned that people with sensitive skin can often have adverse reaction to Vitamin C which can be harsh. I stopped using it & my skin cleared up!! Beware if you have sensitive skin!!

review_text: I’ve only used this serum for a few weeks, but I can tell you that I love it!  It is a thick gel (thicker than the DE Firma C serum) and the directions say to shake it before using to redistribute the ingredients.  I use this at night 2-4 times a week.  I apply it, let it sink in for 1-2 minutes while I finish getting ready for bed, and apply my moisturizer on top.  After a few weeks of this serum + the Firma C serum (in the mornings, under regular moisturizer), my skin has noticeably cleared up (less persistent acne - I still get hormonal or stress related breakouts, but that’s to be expected), become more evenly toned (fewer red blotches and faint acne scars!), and has a more consistent and smooth texture (smaller looking nose pores!).  I haven’t seen this level of results with any other product, including prescription medications.  I also love the company’s principle of not adding unnecessary ingredients and how well they package the product (to keep the active ingredients as fresh and active as possible).  I also think the bottles are fantastic design, great for every day use at home or for travel. I love DE!
product_name: T.L.C. Framboos Glycolic Resurfacing Night Serum

review_text: I am in love after one steam! I had debated on this for months due to the price. I finally asked for it from my BF for my birthday and he delivered! As soon as you take it out of the box, you can tell how well it is made. Very sturdy, yet I could see this as something easy to pack if you are traveling with it. The reservoir is small and the steam will stop after about 8 minutes or so no need to time yourself. I hear others complain of a plastic smell, I do smell it too but it does not bother me. I like that the steam is so strong (but doesn’t burn you) that you don’t even have to place a towel over your head, the steam is powerful. It’s nice to sit upright and just let the steam do it’s thing (I used to boil water on the stove and bend over with a towel to steam, this is so much better). I bought the mini peels to go along with this and I used the PC serum and it worked out beautifully. My face feels so hydrated and refreshed and it helped me sinuses. I am very pleased with this product. Buy it if you are on the fence. You won’t be disappointed. This looks like a product that will last years with the proper care of course.

review_text: I remember hearing about this product from a coworker who described it as being “just baking soda“  Boy was she wrong!  This gentle exfoliator is pretty awesome and a little goes a long way so it’s actually a pretty good value.  In my experience my skin appeared to get worse as far as peeling and dryness after I started using it, but this was nothing a good moisturizer couldn’t help.  Soon after I started noticing how soft and supple my skin felt.  I also really like how such a small amount really works once you mix in a little bit of water.  It’s really easy to use and does produce great results!  I can see why it gets so many awards and accolades!**This product was provided to me gratis by BzzAgent in exchange for my honest review**

review_text: I will admit I’m not a huge believer in having to have an eye cream as part of my skincare routine. I haven’t had the best luck with them as I find my skin is very sensitive and I easily develop little bumps around my eye when I use something too emollient. This product on the other hand has a been a life saver during the wintertime as I find it really does moisturize without feeling heavy. I’ve been very minimal with my makeup as were in quarantine so I’ve been more focused on skin care and I will definitely be adding this to my routine. My top concerns are brightening and moisturizing for my under eye and I feel like this does both very well. It makes my fine lines non existent because my under eye is actually moisturized. review_text: For the price I would have expected this to be the best lip balm I’ve used. Unfortunately, it’s just a lip balm. Nothing about it has particularly stood out as extra special for me. I don’t mind the shape or style. I put it on about 8 minutes ago and my lips are still quite smooth and balmy, so I can’t imagine I’d put it around my eye area as the packaging suggests - all I can think of is wisps of hair sticking to it, or my eyeliner melting. I’m not recommending it simply because I don’t think the value matches the price. Would I pay $8 for this 0.13 oz product? Maybe, but only if my Burt’s Bees wasn’t nearby for $4 (0.15 oz).
review_title: It's a nice lip balm, but way overpriced.

review_text: I’m pleased with these gel patches - they do what they need to do! After using, I noticed that the skin under my eyes looked more moisturized, plump, and less “wrinkly“ (I’m only 24, but this did visibly reduce some of the little creasing under my eyes. I’d use before applying concealer for a smooth finish!). HOWEVER, I would recommend leaving these on much longer than the 15 mins indicated in the instructions. The first time I used them, I left on for 20 mins and really didn’t see a difference. The second time, I took a 2-hr nap in them and saw the intended effects.

review_text: Does everything it says it will do. I have combo acne prone sensitive skin. My skin breaks out to almost every product i try and i get clogged pores easily. I actually bought this product about a year ago when i was going through it with my skin and after the first night it made such a huge improvement on my texture and dry patches. It minimized the size of my acne too. I used to switch between this product and my curology so i used it every other night. I used it for a while and stopped when my skin got cleared up. Now a year later and my skin is acting up again with random dry patches and acne. After the first night of using it again my skin is so smooth and looks so much better. It does make my face feel warm but it doesnt irritate my skin. You have to follow instructions and be careful with the other products you use along with it. Whenever i use this i dont use any other strong products, just mild cleansers and moisturizer. I try to keep the rest of my skincare routine simple and clean because i find it does the job better that way. (I also used to shave my face and noticed my skin was irritated from that and trying so many products to calm it down) * photo is from last year when it was at its worst, second photo is from a few weeks ago with no make up*
product_name: Alpha Beta Extra Strength Daily Peel Pads

review_text: Purchased the smaller bottle of this because I wanted to try it out. I have very sensitive skin and it tends to get oily with any moisturizer by the end of the day. This is different and def loving it. It’s a gel which I know can make a lot of people hesitant, but don’t be. It takes a little bit to fully rub into your face and it also takes a second to dry down (your face is a little tacky for a few moments). Once it does dry down my skin is hydrated but matte and not greasy. Best of all, my face has been staying matte ALL DAY. I have yet to put makeup over it, but with a matte foundation as well, I can’t imagine myself getting oily. Will def be purchasing the larger bottle with a pump.

review_text: Dehydrated and sensitive skin saver. Pricy but worth every penny
review_text_clean: dehydrated and sensitive skin saver. pricy but worth every penny

review_text: This is indeed lovely, it’s a very fine mist (reminds you of fog) and leaves a hydrating but not greasy dew. Keep in mind, the bottle is ridiculously small and you run out quickly.. But whether it’s worth the price, I’m not quite sure... I think the Mario Badescu mist is cheaper and is just as nice.
review_title: Lovely mist, very expensive, small bottle!
